channel.title: A few small problems
channel.description:
Well, actually this isn't the first time I've played MoparScape. I played a while back...god know how long ago. Maybe two to three years ago. I don't know if anything has changed (aside from obvious things I've noticed like the server status page and the webclient), but things seem a little more complicated than they were back then.
[u]Clarifying: I'm not making a server, I just downloaded these from the download section.[/u]
Alright, so here's my problem. I've got a couple of errors that I'm hoping some of you can help me solve. Before you say it, [b]yes[/b] I have the latest JDK version, [b]yes[/b] I used the search option, [b]yes[/b] I looked at all the tutorials, [b]yes[/b] I read every FAQ, and as far as I know, I've tried everything to my knowledge (note the my knowledge part). None of them helped. [u] My first problem is this[/u]: Every server I try to log onto on the web client says "Error Connecting to Server. Must be down." Honestly, all of them can't be down. Like I said I have the latest version of JDK and all that shebang. Does anyone have tips?
[u]Second Problem[/u]: Many of the servers that I've downloaded to use on my computer do not let me log in. Every time it's "You are already logged in." I've tried restarting the server, I've went through the files and deleted my account, I've compiled, downloaded the 'Perfect' compiler just like the tutorial recommended, reinstalled MoparScape, and tried other servers. Nothing. All say that I'm already logged in.Tips would be appreciated.
Kind of made me wonder if maybe I have been extracting the files wrong? Here are screenshots of how I have it set up:
[u]MAIN[/u]
[IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v408/snowfox10/m1.png[/img]
[u]INSIDE SERVER FILE[/u]
[IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v408/snowfox10/m2.png[/img] [u] INSIDE CLIENTS FILE[/u]
[IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v408/snowfox10/m3.png[/img]
[u]INSIDE TOOLS FILE[/u]
[IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v408/snowfox10/m4.png[/img]
[u]INSIDE MOPARSCAPE FILE[/u]
[IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v408/snowfox10/m5.png[/img]
-
Anyway, those are my main problems. If it helps, here's some of these errors I get too.
This is what it also says when I get the "Your account is already logged in" error. I've set the path like it said in one of the tutorials.
[IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v408/snowfox10/m7.png[/img]
And here is what happens when I try to compile:
[IMG]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v408/snowfox10/m8.png[/img]
I hope the information I provided is enough, if you need more just request it. Hope someone can help. Thanks.

item.title: A few small problems
item.dc:creator: @Never_Summer Never Summer
item.description:
@Never_Summer wrote:

I feel like I’m not understanding some of the things you are telling me correctly. Just to clarify, I’m not making a server, I just downloaded it off of the downloads section.

Anyway, so what I did was double click the “d d s p 3” server that I downloaded, right clicked, added a new folder called “connectedfrom” as so:

The blue folder is the “connectedfrom” folder. The same error was still there.

Read full topic

item.title: A few small problems
item.dc:creator: @Delta2 Delta_
item.description:
@Delta2 wrote:

Go into your server, and right click -> new folder. Then name it connectedfrom, that should fix your problem. If not post the problem

Read full topic

item.title: A few small problems
item.dc:creator: @Never_Summer Never Summer
item.description:
@Never_Summer wrote:

What do you mean by a connectedfrom folder? Like something to link them all together?

Read full topic

item.title: A few small problems
item.dc:creator: @bcdutton bcdutton
item.description:
@bcdutton wrote:

The error in your picture if obvious. You don’t have a “connectedfrom” folder within your server. Create one

Read full topic

item.title: A few small problems
item.dc:creator: @rob014 rob014
item.description:
@rob014 wrote:

The Server you downloaded …

@echo off COLOR 09 title (name of server) java -Xmx1000m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 highmem members 32 pause

this anit the one i use but its the one my mate uses dunno if its any good if not i’ll go home and seand you the one i uses

yah sorry about you not understanding me kinda busy

Read full topic

item.title: A few small problems
item.dc:creator: @Never_Summer Never Summer
item.description:
@Never_Summer wrote:

[quote=“rob014, post:2, topic:224605”]Dunno if this is any good but meh dont flame…

befor like its happed 3-5times now i have got that on the run.bet just chnage the run.bat i use the same one all the time now and the same compiler for every server i give a test never get’s any problums[/quote]

I don’t really know what I’m doing here, just basic computer usage skills. I wouldn’t have any right to flame you.

Can you go into a little more detail possibly? When you say change the run.bat, what do I change it to? And do I change in my the MoparScape file or on the servers that I’ve downloaded?

Read full topic
